body: Yep, mistune was just upgraded and included. Perhaps you need to "python setup.py submodule"?

sorry to open this again. Same problem here. Installed mistune but still getting AttributeError: type object 'BlockLexer' has no attribute 'default_features'. Amateur question, but what do you mean by "python setup.py submodule"?

> AttributeError: type object 'BlockLexer' has no attribute 'default_features'

which version of mistune you have installed?

> Amateur question, but what do you mean by "python setup.py submodule"?

`python setup.py submodule` get the IPython components submodule (IPython's external javascript dependencies living in a separate repo) in sync with the IPython master repo...

This is still happening. 

I see the commits mentioning `mistune` renaming `default_features` in my `git log` output.  But it still seems to expect that attribute?

mistune:

```
gus at jupiter in ~ (py279) 
$ pip search mistune
mistune                   - The fastest markdown parser in pure Python
  INSTALLED: 0.5 (latest)
Flask-Mistune             - A interface between the Flask web framework and the Mistune Markdown parser.
mistune-contrib           - Contribution for Mistune
mistune-renderers         - Renderers for Mistune

```

ipython commit: 

```
commit 88b3f6291b1bd9a52c50f026f2c1a0b407e4f318
Merge: 3a47223 3541307
Author: Matthias Bussonnier <bussonniermatthias@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 28 16:38:50 2014 +0100

    Merge pull request #7283 from minrk/kernel-spec-model

    add resource URLs to kernelspec model
```

submodules:

```
Submodule path 'IPython/html/static/components': checked out '6b578bb789708ded9b6611039d162c71135dfd68'
```

Try pip install mistune --upgrade

You mean instead of -U? Bc I'm pretty sure that won't magically install a
version of mistune later than the latest which is what I installed
yesterday. Has it been updated since then?

I listed the version of mistune I am running in my comment.  Is there a latter version that 0.5?  Cause if so, `pip` doesnt seem to know about it.

There are two similar but distinct error messages involved. If you see:

```
AttributeError: type object 'BlockLexer' has no attribute 'default_rules'
```

Then you're using an older version of mistune and need to upgrade it (`pip install -U mistune`)

If you see:

```
AttributeError: type object 'BlockLexer' has no attribute 'default_features'
```

Then you're running an older commit of IPython 3.0-dev, and you need to grab the latest. If you think you're already on the latest, chances are you're in Python packaging hell, and the version it's importing is not the version you thought you'd installed.

Ah sorry, I respond from mail and didn't saw the mistune part, so you might have editted your message, sorry. 

After re-reading, as thomas said, you might not be on the last version of IPython. try nuking your virtual env, and reinstall.

Holy crap, @takluyver, THANK YOU.

That was really informative. I will try looking into that.  I posted the commit hash I am using which was the latest as of the time I posted so I must be in hell.  I will work on that now!

SO MUCH THANKS!

Gus

You're welcome. I had to go and look up which way round it was, but I wanted to make a clear description of the two possible problems for other people who might run into one of them and read this discussion.

# update:

It seems like @takluyver  was right. I took @Carreau's advice and did a full install in a new virtualenv:

```
# install the latest pulled version of the master branch
$ pip install $HOME/repos/git/ipython  

# install the rest of ipython's reqs
$ pip install "ipython[all]" 
```

This worked.

I then went back to my main virtualenv and uninstalled my ipython then repeated the above and a few more packages were installed (`Sphinx numpydoc docutils`) which means SOMETHING was clearly not perfect in my installation from before, but those packages don't LOOK like they would cause the issue to me?

Who knows.  It works now.  Thank you both very much.

Gus

Which version of `mistune` would be needed for 

```
AttributeError: type object 'BlockLexer' has no attribute 'default_rules'
```

?

I'm seeing this with the newest 0.7.1 version over here.

Make absolutely sure that you're importing the version that you think you're importing, because `BlockLexer.default_rules` should definitely be there in mistune 0.7.1:

https://github.com/lepture/mistune/blob/v0.7.1/mistune.py#L164
